intro: Retanilla spinifera, commonly known as the spiny retanilla, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. Retanilla spinifera is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
